creator: seade@apache.org
text:
It is fairly difficult to enter data into fields in the JMeter GUI when running
jdk 1.4.1 (or 1.4.1_01).  It appears that the focusing implementation has
changed from that in jdk 1.4.0 which operates correctly (the workaround is to
run JMeter using jdk 1.4.0).

Accepting bug. Marking as High Priority, because it's a real pain and affects
each and every user on 1.4.1 (which is probably most users now, since 1.4 was
required for a while).
creator: jsalvata@atg.com

text:
I found problems in the TestPlan and HTTP Request/HTTP Request Defaults tables
and fixed them using the default editor/renderer in the Arguments panel.Looks a
little bit ugly now on my Linux box using JRE 1.3.1, but it works with 1.3.1 and
1.4.1 and is consistent with the other tables (e.g. User Parameters).

All other input fields seem to be ok, so I resolve this bug to FIXED.
creator: oros@apache.org

text: *** Bug 12354 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
creator: oros@apache.org

text: Bulk-editing to close all bugs reported fixed by 1.8.1.
creator: jsalvata@atg.com
